revised_title: The Dynamics and Origin of Planetary Rings: A Focus on Narrow, Eccentric Rings
tldr: This article discusses the discovery and analysis of planetary rings around Jupiter, Saturn, and Uranus. The focus is on the narrow, eccentric rings, which present complex dynamical problems. The author explores the gravitational action of small satellites on the orbits of ring particles and the various factors that contribute to the structure and origin of these rings.
